It's not an Issue, but rather an Request for Implementation of a Feature.
The Feature is - as i understood - that hovering inactive Tabs on the Tabstrip should bring up the Link Status as when you hover over a Link in a Page's Content.

comments.raw_text: Not just the link status. I was actually asking for the tab url along with the currently displayed tab title in the tooltip.

Added a screenshot for what is expected of this requirement.
The screenshot contains 2 images: (1) What happens and (2) What is required.

Pls note that this requirement would be applicable not only to "inactive tabs", but also "active tabs" and "pinned app tabs".

---------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------

Restating the requirement in my words:
  - Show URL in popup when any tab is hovered.

It would be useful in cases when:
  - Pages don't have titles
  - Pages cannot have titles (like viewing CSS/JS code files)
  - Multiple tabs have same title (generally happens on different
      pages in a single site with same site title)

comments.text:
This bug is marked to be blocked by issue #662923.
But this issue can probably be resolved without depending on that issue. To me it seems that resolving issue #649448 would resolve this issue as well if we choose to show the URL on hovering a tab in any scenario (active/inactive/pinned app tab).
